Sequence Information.Peptide Name: MiAMP2b (Macadamia integrifolia antimicrobial peptide 2b, natural AMPs;  plants; UCSS1a; Inactive: MiAMP2a)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against fungi. Said active but not clear to what bacteria and fungi.Sequence analysis: Interestingly, this peptide contains four repeated segments with the four-cysteine motif C-X-X-X-C-(10Â±12)X-C-X-X-X-C that is present in the MiAMP2 protein. Similar proteins in different plants can have a variable number of such repeating motifs (see Fig 4 of this ref).No activity was found for MiAMP2a. Updated 5/2017.
Literature Information.Author: Marcus JP, Green JL, Goulter KC, Manners JM.1999
Literature Information.Title: A family of antimicrobial peptides is produced by processing of a 7S globulin protein in Macadamia integrifolia kernels.
